results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology, describing two randomized experiments investigating the effects of explanations on educators’ attitudes towards algorithms. (e.g., "In two randomized experiments (𝑁 = 570), we compare educator preferences...")

The document provides a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design for both Study 1 and Study 2, including participant recruitment, procedure, experimental manipulation, and measures. (e.g., "Study 1 employed a two (explanation) by two (visualization) between-subjects design...")
The document states that all code, data, and supplementary materials are available on OSF: "All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF."
Data is shared, so justification for not sharing is not applicable.

The document mentions a data dictionary or codebook explaining variables, formats, and preprocessing steps is available on OSF: "Materials on OSF https://osf.io/7c5zt/?view_only= 58f0a6314e9243e9acdbd1c844d43d7b."

Data collection methods are fully described, including recruitment through Prolific, survey administration, and the use of specific scales and questionnaires. (e.g., "We recruited 170 participants from Prolific...")
The document states that the analysis code is shared on OSF: "All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF."
Code is shared, so justification for not sharing is not applicable.
The document states that code for data preparation is available on OSF: "All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF."
Statistical tests (linear regression) and models are clearly described. (e.g., "We examined how algorithm preference varies across experimental conditions by fitting a linear regression model.")
Effect sizes (e.g., 0.25), confidence intervals, and p-values are reported throughout the results sections. (e.g., "(𝐹3,164 = 0.4454,𝑝 = 0.7209)")
Subjective context and interpretation are given through the thematic analysis of open-ended responses. (e.g., discussion of themes emerging from the notes to parents)
Data coding and analysis are described, including the identification of themes in the notes to parents. (e.g., "We categorized the notes into three levels of detail about the algorithm...")
The results are clearly presented using tables, figures, and descriptive text. (e.g., Figure 2a, Table 1)

Limitations and potential biases are discussed, including the use of Prolific participants and the context-specificity of the study. (e.g., "First, the data collected was from educators on Prolific…")
The document contains a link to the preregistration on OSF: "The study was preregistered on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu."
